pros: 10/10 this place was incredible to work at
cons: I have no complaints about this job

pros: Everyone gets along with everyone it's a small building but brings people closer together and a lot of teamwork

job_title: Performance Improvement Coordinator in Columbia, MO
pros: Nice team with an engaged manager
cons: Slow to make any changes

pros: Great work environment and great people to work with.
cons: Could be a little unorganized at times.

review_title: Malignant Management, steer clear of this place!
pros: The people you work with, who are overworked and underpaid, that struggle with you every single day are the only PRO about In-Patient Pharmacy.
cons: Turn over rate is high. No one is trained properly or even set up for success. No option for growth. You are expected to work 3+ positions/responsibilities/job titles at the same time every single day. Way understaffed. Way over worked. I would never get a full lunch. I would be lucky to get one for 5 minutes. I barely have time to go to the bathroom. Constantly cleaning up after fellow co-workers and picking up lots of slack. Call-ins at a high volume every day. No employee is punished for high volumes of call-ins. They cannot afford to lose you no matter how terrible you are cause no one wants to work there. They do not hire enough. As soon as you get hired you want to quit. I had less stress managing a store than working there. Longest technician is 1 year experience. Everyone else is new working 1-3 months long and soon to quit themselves. Most and soon all the good technicians have quit giving less than 2 week notice. Management does not exist and punishes good workers. Benefits in the health care system are terrible. I got better insurance working at a grocery store part time versus full time in pharmacy. You do not get appreciated or respected for hard work and dedication.

pros: This institution helps educate you as a new grad. There are learning opportunities to get involved in. The benefits are decent, they were better prior to the changes recently made.
cons: Nurse pay is low compared to other hospitals in the area. Everywhere is understaffed currently but there has been a strain on nurses. There is a high volume of patients and not enough staff. The hospital has relied on lots of travel nurses. There is poor management in several divisions of the hospital and leadership continues to change for the worse.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Columbia, MO
pros: The benefits are amazing, good value.
cons: Staffing level is not always up to par

review_title: Great Place to work! You are Among Family!
pros: Great Team! Family-orientated environment! Great Tuition Plan!
cons: Need more flexible hours options.

pros: -Good team in department outside of management
cons: -Non flexible scheduling -Poor management

pros:
*Good pay (compared to Boone Health)
*Great benefits
*Interesting and specialized work environments if you are considering staying lateral with the company and not moving up
*Lots of opportunities for advancement if desired
*Great onboarding
cons:
*Parking structure
*Workplace culture is difficult to acclimate to
*Poor work/life balance in certain departments 
*Leadership and politics can be disappointing and hard to navigate
*Workplace gossip is not minimized by leadership, but sadly created and exacerbated - creates an atmosphere of not feeling supported and not being able to respect your superiors as well as trust your co-workers
*Units should have specialized education materials detailing work environment and tasks - with highly trained unit/professional preceptors who create a comfortable learning environment and successful acclimation for new hires

pros: Great culture, great coworkers, nice environment
cons: Pay is not competitive, no extra pay for BSN, critical care, extra certifications, etc. No fertility benefits, maternal leave, short term disability, etc

pros: The pay and benefits. The insurance is really good.
cons: Management not conveying what they need out of you.

pros:
The coworkers are the best thing about this place. Life long friends and great teamwork.

The healthcare is pretty good!! But, they keep doubling the price every year.
cons: Like any hospital these days, CEOs and higher ups just squeeze as much as they can out of you. You’re required to do more and more and more and not compensated while they try and make the job of 5 people into just a one person job while the rich get the benefit. Our entire unit pretty much left to go to travel nursing or just get out of bedside nursing in general because it’s not worth it anymore.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Columbia, MO
pros: Atmosphere and co-workers are great.
cons: Senior Management doesn't live in reality world and needs to visit the floors more often.

review_title: Great place to learn. Worse place to work.

review_title: Horrible. The only culture welcomed here is the culture of yes.
pros:
-Great benefits.
-Night shift was able to purchase food.
cons:
-Have to pay for employee parking in the garage.
-Racist staff and environment: I have been told to go back to my own country and was subsequently laughed at by other staff members once this was uttered.
-Many racist words and terms were often said by staff members to describe both patients and colleagues.
-Managers often turned a blind eye to bullying performed by certain RNs on units- this would often result in extremely unsafe patient assignments. Favoritism was rampant. I had to report objective patient acuity reports to prove that I was being handed full patient assignments of full-care patients.
-Employees are non-supportive and extremely hateful.

pros: Benefits, salary, time off, work hours

review_title: It all about sports and saving a buck
pros: You can earn a paycheck rather than living as a homeless person.   You can say that you work at MIZZOU and people who have never worked there think that it is great!  But you know that by working there you are letting yourself and your professional integrity down and you are working for a medical institution that cares nothing for its patients and everything for its  "tiger image".
cons: There is no chance for further  education about anyhing but the mandatory things like fire safety, etc.  You will never get to go to a conference unless you pay your way yourself and are willing to use your own vacation time and can get it approved.   Once you sign on for a position you stay there regardless if there is a more appropriate job for you that you would truly excel at.   They work by fear tactics --- if you don't follow the exact directions of administration you can lose your job.  Worst of all it is NOT all about the patient.  It is about the almighty dollar and how to keep it at MIZZOU.

job_title: Med Lab Tech in Gulfport, MS
pros: Loved my pay, benefits, work duties, coworkers, location.
cons: Needed more space (bigger building).

review_title: Job was ok, but not given compensation deserved.
job_title: Pharmacy Technician (In Patient) in Columbia, MO
pros:
Good people to work with.
Learned a lot. 
Fairly flexible with requests off (except holidays - expect to work Christmas Eve and Christmas if you're new)
cons: There were two of us hired at the same time, we were both told we'd be part time as they didn't have any full time positions available. I was told I'd average about 20 hours a week, the other person was told about 10. We both worked no less than 30 hours any week, often times 40. When we had consistently worked 30-40 hours for several months, we asked about getting the benefits package for full time which is technically 32 hours a week. They told us they couldn't because they didn't have the budget for any more full time employees. 3 weeks later they hired two brand new employees as full time pharmacy techs.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Columbia, MO
pros: Cross training between different tasks is great and helps an employee feel well acclimated to the job and department. Overall friendly staff (with the exception of management), and usually a laid back atmosphere while at work.
cons: Terrible on-boarding processes from HR all the way through the department level training. Poor communication from Pharmacy management with regards to expectations, procedures, practices, and even follow through with organizational policies. Blatant disregard for employees mental and physical health with ample staffing problems and overall low pay for he amount of work needed to be completed.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Assistant in Columbia, MO
pros: Good benefits, friendly co-workers, flexible scheduling
cons: "Culture of Yes" is a joke, employees expected to follow the culture but not upper management, lack of communication between management and employees, high turnover, next to no opportunity for advancement, management is for management they do not back the employees, establishment is very top heavy, no effort made to retain quality workers, it's not what you know but who you know

review_title: Staff is overscheduled and management lacks communication in Psych Center
pros:
Benefits
Pay
Wellness Incentives, Healthy culture
Rewarding work
Culture of Yes
Good food, discounts
cons:
High Turnover
Mandated Overtime
Staff often complains about scheduling and how they are overworked, forced to work certain holidays without being allowed to switch.
Management doesn't seem to have much contact with nursing staff, and there doesn't seem to be a system in place for discussing performance.
Clear rules for what patients are and are not allowed to do are not in place
Lack of communication between staff, social workers, nurses, and management

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Columbia, MO
pros: Health care benefits, hefty discount on University of Missouri courses
cons: Low pay in comparison to demanding work. Clientele can be extremely hard to handle. Getting cursed at on a regular basis by patients for things you have no control over. Management is unwilling to make any improvements to processes. One of the most senior PSRs can become hostile toward coworkers, once stated "I don't care if I lose my job as long as I get to yell at *coworker*".

review_title: Not a bad place to start, but retirement is unlikely.
pros: My fellow coworkers make this job fun.  I am usually free of direct supervision, which provides for a reduced stress environment.  Taking care of the citizens of mid-missouri and it's visitors gives me that "warm and fuzzy" feeling.
cons: Below cost of living "cost of living" raises make it difficult to keep turnover down.  The longer an employee works here, the less they effectively make.  That is, new hires get the going salary, while those that have dedicated years are given ~2% annually for a "raise."  Other benefits are mediocre.  Few advancement opportunities causes low morale; those that want to advance to their fullest potential feel as though they are perpetually "swimming against the current."

review_title: They talk a good game but...
pros: My coworkers were amazing. Individually they cared about their job very much and were responsible and accountable.
cons: Poor morale, poor teamwork, saw manager 4 times in a year, employee engagement is fake; they ask questions and have surveys but nothing changes, the employees do all the bending to make things work and management cuts the employees no slack, poor organization; mandatory education announced 1-2 weeks prior to obligation, management uncaring, new rules/policies/procedures/charting with no guidance on implementation, patient information packets had inaccurate information and this was brought to the attention of management and in a year it was never corrected leading to decreased patient satisfaction

review_title: Decent place for a student, mediocre place for a career.
pros: Lots of on the job work experience. A varied field of patients to learn about. The University will assist you if you are trying to go to school.
cons: Management is in transition and the future of the facility is in question. Mediocre management. Staff and management can be unprofessional in the workplace. Salary and pay is generally based on degree not experience. The facility is a training ground for doctor's going through school so their Psychiatric knowledge is poor and usually they only care enough to protect their career.

review_title: A great position as far as Med Tech jobs go!
pros: My direct managers and laboratory administration was wonderful. Lots of opportunity to progress and develop professionally as an individual.
cons: Many other laboratory staff members are long-time employees and occasionally act as a force against positive change. It is very difficult to enact change here due to hierarchical order, but many new supervisors and managers are working to change this and make staff voices heard.

review_title: Too many people not willing to make tough decisions.
job_title: Mechanical Plant Specialist in Columbia, MO
pros: The benefits are pretty good as far as health coverage, sick and vacation leave. They have an employee tuition reimbursement program that is pretty great.
cons: Management is a culture that is unwilling to accept change. They do not want to make important decisions about much of anything. Getting a straight answer from management is harder than getting one from a politician running for office.

pros: Excellent benefits including tuition reduction for employees and their families.  Monthly rounding with every staff member and their leadership team to assess their needs.   They promote from within as much as possible.
cons: Due to the fact that it is a healthcare environment, staff members must report to work during inclement weather.  However, the organization does provide a service to help those that cannot drive themselves in.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Columbia, MO
pros: Great coworkers, and great teamwork between 90% of the MHT's, nursing staff, and physicians. Quick paced and active.
cons: Management needs a reality check. They play favorites constantly and if you aren't a favorite, then you get screwed all the time. It is a physically dangerous position, and the "defensive training" you get isn't worth a damn. The environment is also toxic and they will throw lower staff under the bus constantly.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Columbia, MO
pros: Patient-Customer Service skill building, corporate medical institution and structure is great for getting one’s foot in the door of a non-clinical/Office Admin setting leading to higher paying positions if you stick it out
cons: Computerized Annual Learning Plan was repetitive and boring; bureaucratic hierarchy in management; one must work on personability in order to not feel like another cog in the wheel; frequent interactions with seriously upset patients

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Columbia, MO
pros: Innovative environment. Research driven hospital. Tuition reimbursement for employees and families is phenomenal. Baylor shifts are great for those who do and who do not like to work weekends.
cons: Low pay. No growth in position unless you want to take on management.

review_title: Thrown under bus by nurse manager, instead of taught the correct way.
pros: This job taught me what I do not want when looking ahead at other jobs.  I realized that living in a state with mandated nurse-patient ratios is key to not being overworked and put into an unsafe work environment.
cons: Pay is awful, management does not look out for your best interest, staffing is horrible, no nurse tech help, long hours with no guaranteed breaks, do not teach as much as they should given that this is a teaching hospital.  Unsupportive of their new staff.

pros: Benefits are good. Co-workers very skilled and a joy to work with.
cons: Management seems to not care about the employees or patients. Focus is mainly on Picker scores to increase revenues. They want to obtain Magnet status but are unwilling to have the necessary decision making of employees. Unwilling to relinquish control.

pros: Have a flexible schedule, offer tuition benefit for working 32+ hours per week, always looking to hire new people, managers that are good at listening and friendly, great pay for Missouri standards, friendly staff
cons: Required to work every other weekend, sometimes is a tough job due to number of patients in hospital, fast pace to keep up with high number of patients

pros: The $2 extra during night shift and on the weekends you get our $4 extra if you work nights. Seeing some of the patients really puts life in perspective for you (e.g. what you want for yourself health wise)
cons: Pay attention to the lazy workers. Instead of having spent all that money on the tugs they should’ve bought a new dishwasher. Having things break down consistently makes your job a lot harder.

review_title: Miserable place to work, entirely because of the management structure.
job_title: Direct Patient Care in Columbia, MO
pros: The doctors and nurses are, with very few exceptions, competent and caring
cons: the administration is not interested in hearing what those competent and caring front-line healthcare workers have to say.  90% of the people  I know here are   considering leaving or counting the minutes to retirement

pros: great benefits and competitive starting  salary
cons: You can tell management (multiple departments) didn't care about employees. Just cared about patient volume. I was told by a physician in our department the hospital goal is to work at 60% of what is needed (6 employees for ever 10 the numbers say we need).

review_title: An Over-All Good Place to Work; No Real Opportunity for Growth
pros:
The benefits  are great: Health care, vacation/sick/personal time are outstanding
The people are decent
cons:
For the time being, there is no real opportunity for professional growth.

pros: The people I work with are Great. We all make a great team. Benefits are good. Pay is mediocre.
cons: Too much “talk” not enough “action” in the form of values and following through. Too many chiefs and not enough Indians so to speak.

review_title: Working with the University Hospital was challenging.
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Columbia, MO
pros: The company offers great employee benefits including a 457 and 401K matching after you are vested. Coming into my position as a PSR (Patient Service Representative) , I was given classroom and a lot of hands-on training and development. While working for the company I gained a lot of experience in guest relations and technical support. My team had varied levels of education and outside work experiences, allowing for a lot of diversity and skills. My team supported my growth and encouraged me. The care was highly patient oriented and focused around the “culture of yes.” The University Hospital is a great place to be a patient but terrible to be an employee.
cons: I was hesitant from hearing a lot of negative feedback regarding management and disciplinary action taken against hard working employees. My specific clinic had a lot of trouble keeping employees because of poor employee supervision on the part of the current coordinator. While she wa highly knowledgeable of her role, she would constantly harass her employees with degrading emails even causing team members to cry at work in front of patients. After speaking to HR, they would not allow me to switch positions and actually stood behind my supervisor’s harassment of her employees. In that moment I lost all respect for the University Hospital, but I have hopes that the healthcare system will better develop their coordinators in the future.

pros: Ever since I began working for the Health Care Accounting Department it has been a relaxed atmosphere. We get our work done, and we are good at it, but there is an emphasis on fun in the work place. This is definitely not a place that I dread having to work.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Working its way to the top in premium health care!
pros: Competitive pay, great benefits! Most people are easy to get along with.  Micro-managing is at a minimum.
cons: If employees are a problem, and there are valid complaints, make the changes, or employees will leave, or transfer to a different department.

review_title: This was a great experience for me as a new grad with excellent management in the diagnostic imaging department.

cons: Lack of ownership with many of the attending physicians when it came to mentoring the resident physicians.

review_title: Awful, too much red tape and politics

review_title: Poor management with little regard for employee wellbeing
pros: MU offers decent benefits to employees
cons: Awful management, poor conditions, cut a lot of corners in food production, overworking employees and not providing tools to success. Expect a poor work space, demeaning management and obscenely high turnover.
